subject: how do we promote a phonemic/phonetic writing sytem for english
msgSnippet: either through a new writing sytem and/or a modification of the existing Roman one where each sound is represented either by it s own symbol and/or a
messageBody:
either through a new writing sytem and/or a modification of the
existing Roman one where each sound is represented either by it's
own symbol and/or a consistent set of symbols (sometimes doubled?)
if using traditional Roman script

Evidently Spanish in 1713 changed it's writing system to be phonemic
(albeit not perfectly) unlike English

and there's been various attempts at doing this with english
(Deseret, Shavian, Read, (and one I can't remember the title for but
modified Roman script), I.T.E. etc)

if english is going to the defacto lingua franca (I would prefer
something like Esperanto instead given it's simplicity), then we
need to figure out a way to not only make it easier to use (i.e.-
phonetic/phonemic), but also in a way that we can popularize.

Feedback welcome, I'm new at all this.
